abstract: Navy's investigation into fighter jet collision that killed pilot Nathan Poloski sheds light on dangerous conditions under which naval aviators work, even when not at war; assigns no blame to either pilot, but notes that 'situational awareness' of all involved could have been better.
lead_paragraph: An investigation into the crash that killed Lt. Nathan Poloski assigned no blame but concluded that it might have been prevented by more “situational awareness.”

headline.main: A Navy Pilot’s Death Reflects the Everyday Hazards of the Job
headline.print_headline: A Navy Pilot’s Death Reflects the Everyday Hazards of the Job

snippet: An investigation into the crash that killed Lt. Nathan Poloski assigned no blame but concluded that it might have been prevented by more “situational awareness.”
